abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Programmatic Development
            Policy Grant is the third and final operation in a
            programmatic sequence that supports the government's
            reform program outlined in the Tajikistan first and second
            poverty reduction strategy. Its development objectives are
            to improve the environment for private sector development,
            and to improve overall functioning of the public sector and
            the delivery of key public services. The program is divided
            into two pillars each with several components with pillar
            one promoting private sector development. First component is
            to maintain macroeconomic stability; second component is to
            improve investment climate through reform of licensing and
            inspections, increasing transparency of the privatization
            process and promoting market competition; and third
            component is to reform regulatory frameworks by separating
            policy making from regulatory functions in key strategic
            sectors (aviation, cotton, and energy). Pillar two: improve
            public sector management and public service delivery. First
            component is public sector management reform through
            restructuring of core public institutions, reforms of civil
            service management and wage system, strengthening of the
            medium-term expenditure framework; and second component is
            improving social service delivery in health and education.
